blog_content:
In this write up we will solve Bandit1 level, doing so will give us the password for level2. We got the password for Level 1 when we solved Level 0. (Read OverTheWire: Bandit: Solving Bandit 0 -> Bandit 1).

The prompt for Level1 is -



The prompt tells us that the password will be stored in a file named '-' located in the home directory. Let's try SSHing into the server.

Using the command - 'ssh bandit1@bandit.labs.overthewire.org -p 2220' and the password 'boJ9jbbUNNfktd78OOpsqOltutMc3MY1'. We are able to gain access to the system.



Using 'pwd' to see the directory we are in.



It looks like we are in the home directory. Let's use 'ls' to see the contents of the home directory.



We can see that there is a file named '-' in the home directory.

Using 'cat' to see the contents of the file, command 'cat -'



Well, it gave us no output at all.

Going back to the prompt for Level1 we have link to google search for the term 'dashed filename'. Going through the search results for this search, I landed on some StackOverFlow Answer on how to access a dashed file.

Coming back to the terminal, and now using the command 'cat ./-' to open the contents of the file.



Success!! we were able to open the file and get the password for level2.

password for Level2 is: CV1DtqXWVFXTvM2F0k09SHz0YwRINYA9
